data.title: Top 5 Reasons To Visit Santo Domingo, DR: Things To Do In Santo Domingo Right Now
data.meta_description: Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic, is a modern and dynamic metropolis in the Caribbean. Whether exploring its colonial history, enjoying the beaches, or experiencing its culture, there's something for everyone. Cultural experiences are never far in Santo Domingo’s neighborhoods. T
data.text:
Trending on Google News

Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic, is the most modern and dynamic metropolis in the Caribbean. Whether you're interested in exploring its colonial history, enjoying the beautiful beaches, or experiencing its lively culture, there's something for everyone. La Capital, as it is affectionately called, epitomizes the pulse of Dominican culture—where the old and the new converge seamlessly from centuries old architecture and history, to large shopping malls, art galleries, an electric nightlife, and a booming gastronomy scene. Start your trip by exploring the UNESCO-listed Zona Colonial, the historic heart of Santo Domingo. Here, you'll find well-preserved Spanish colonial architecture, cobblestone streets, and numerous historical sites, including the Alcázar de Colón, the Cathedral of Santa María la Menor, and the Museo de las Casas Reales.

Don't forget to walk along Calle Las Damas, considered the oldest street in the Americas. Beyond the sights, a cultural experience is never far in Santo Domingo’s eclectic neighborhoods. And when you’re ready for the beach, a forty-minute ride lands you onto Boca Chica’s soft, white sands facing a crystal clear Caribbean Sea. Santo Domingo offers a unique blend of history, culture, and natural beauty. Whether you're interested in exploring its historical sites or simply relaxing on the beach, you're sure to have a memorable experience in this vibrant city. These are the top five reasons why Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic should be on your bucket list.

1. Where to Eat in Santo Domingo: The Cuisine + Cocktails

Botaniko Restaurante is a modern, elegant and exclusive institution where culinary excellence and Italian hospitality set the stage for diners to experience a memorable journey, ranging from a classic appetizer to subtle nuances of the tasting menu and the expert recommendations of our sommelier. For your artisanal cocktail fix, we recommend trying two of their signature cocktails, Fiore di Farfalla—concocted with Beefeater infusionado con butterfly pea flower, vermouth seco, syrup de flor de lavanda and edible glitter, or the Italian Night with Jack Daniel's Old #7, Jack Daniel's honey, zumo de limón, granadina, and sprite.

Led by Executive Chef Federico Aureli, the menu at Botaniko Restaurante highlights artisanal pastas, emphasizes quality ingredients and features contemporary dishes inspired by land and sea that excite the palate, and leave culinary lovers wanting more. Favorite dishes include Risotto Zafferano with oro 24k y carabineros riso carnaroli añejo, azafrán, hoja de oro 24k, tartar de camarones carabinero, Arancini Siciliani with croquetas de arroz carnaroli with boloñesa, cacio e pepe, tinta de calamar, Tartar de Atún del Caribe AAA with mango, aguacate, maíz cancha, repollo morado, Tagliatelle Botaniko with tagliatelle verdes frescas hechas a mano, brócoli, espinaca baby, pesto de albahaca y queso ricotta ahumado, Tenderloin Black Angus, an 8-ounce filete, farro a la toscana, salsa a la pimienta, and Tarta de Manzana with manzanas asadas tiernas sobre sablee breton, cremoso de caramelo a la sal, helado de vainilla, and ligero bizcocho de almendras, as well as Caviar y Ostras with blinis, crème fraîche, mantequilla emulsionada, and ostras importadas.

An experience for all the senses, an environment of vegetation, natural materials and spectacular works of art that adorn the spaces, made especially for Botaniko Restaurante by Elvio Tolentino, a proud Dominican who, from Bonao, has taken his talent to the Louvre Carousel in Paris. Open from lunch until late, the stylish restaurant features an extraordinary terrace bar on the second floor.

2. Artistic Heritage: Colonial Zones + Museums

Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic, has a rich and vibrant arts scene with a mix of traditional and contemporary influences. The Museum of the Royal Houses (Museo de las Casas Reales) is a notable institution for colonial art and history. Contemporary art is also thriving in Santo Domingo, with many local artists experimenting with new styles and mediums. You can explore contemporary art galleries and exhibitions throughout the city, particularly in areas like Piantini and Naco. Located in the heart of Santo Domingo, in the cultural district known as the Plaza de la Cultura Juan Pablo Duarte, Museo de Arte Moderno (Museum of Modern Art) is a prominent cultural institution dedicated to showcasing and preserving modern and contemporary art from both Dominican and international artists.

Museo de Arte Moderno is a prominent cultural institution dedicated to showcasing and preserving modern and contemporary art from both Dominican and international artists. The city has several museums and galleries dedicated to various forms of art. The Museo Bellapart is a prominent art museum that features contemporary Dominican art. Other museums like the Museum of Dominican Man (Museo del Hombre Dominicano) offer insights into the country's art and culture.

Street art and murals have become increasingly popular in Santo Domingo. You can find colorful and expressive street art throughout the city, especially in the neighborhoods of Gazcue and Zona Colonial. Some artists have gained international recognition for their work in the street art scene. Art enthusiasts visiting Santo Domingo will find a diverse and dynamic arts scene that reflects the rich cultural heritage and creativity of the Dominican Republic.

3. Luxury Shopping: Piantini District + Blue Mall

Santo Domingo offers a wide range of shopping experiences, from contemporary malls to bustling markets and boutique stores. Whether you're looking for international brands, unique souvenirs, or local crafts, Santo Domingo has something to offer. Agora Mall is one of Santo Domingo's largest and most upscale shopping malls. It features a variety of international and local brands, and designer boutiques.

Another upscale shopping destination, Blue Mall, is known for international brands like Ferragamo, Bulgari, Carolina Herrera, MAC Cosmetics, L’Occitane, and Louis Vuitton. It's a great place for luxury shopping.

If you're looking for a more authentic shopping experience, head to Mercado Modelo. This bustling market is a treasure trove of local crafts, artwork, jewelry, clothing, and souvenirs. In many local markets and smaller shops, bargaining is a common practice. Don't hesitate to negotiate prices, but be respectful in your interactions with sellers.

4. Botanic Beauty: The Jardín Botánico Nacional

The Botanical Garden of Santo Domingo, also known as the Jardín Botánico Nacional, is a beautiful and expansive botanical garden located in the heart of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic. The garden is situated in the western part of Santo Domingo, near the Mirador Sur Park and the National Zoo. It's easily accessible from various parts of the city. Besides its extensive collection of plants, the garden features beautiful walking paths, ponds, and green spaces. It's a serene and peaceful place to explore, making it a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Jardín Botánico Nacional boasts a diverse collection of plant species, including native and exotic plants. There are sections dedicated to different types of flora, such as orchids, palms, cacti, and tropical fruit trees. You'll also find medicinal and aromatic plants, as well as a Japanese garden and a bonsai collection.

5. Architectural Grandeur: Zona Colonial's Historic Treasures

After Christopher Columbus's arrival on the island in 1492, Santo Domingo became the site of the first cathedral, hospital, customs house and university in the Americas. Built between 1514 and 1540, Catedral Primada de América is the oldest in the Americas. Its architecture reflects a mix of Gothic and Baroque styles, and it houses many important religious relics. This colonial town, founded in 1498, was laid out on a grid pattern that became the model for almost all town planners in the New World. The Colonial Zone (Zona Colonial) is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It's home to numerous historic churches, museums, and colonial-era buildings that showcase architecture from the Spanish colonial period. Known as the first paved street in the Americas, Calle Las Damas is lined with historic colonial-era buildings, including the Alcázar de Colón and the Fortaleza Ozama.

Alcázar de Colón is the former palace of Diego Columbus, the son of Christopher Columbus. It's an excellent example of Spanish colonial architecture and has been turned into a museum showcasing period furniture and art. Fortaleza Ozama dates back to the early 1500s and is one of the oldest military structures in the Americas. It played a crucial role in protecting the city from pirates and other threats during colonial times. Casa de los Jesuitas served as the first university in the Americas, founded by the Jesuits in 1538. Exploring the Colonial Zone of Santo Domingo is like taking a step back in time, as you can admire the well-preserved historic architecture that played a pivotal role in the early history of the Americas. It's a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in the rich heritage of the Dominican Republic.

Where to Stay in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic

JW Marriott Hotel Santo Domingo is an award-winning luxury hotel in the Piantini District of Downtown Santo Domingo. Elevate your travel experience at this one-of-a-kind destination in the Dominican Republic. The hotel's prime location places you near the Colonial Zone, Cathedral Primada de América and Alcázar de Colón.

Retreat to your guest room or suite featuring views of Santo Domingo. When you're not exploring Santo Domingo, fit in a workout at the 24-hour fitness center and take a swim in the rooftop infinity pool. On your next visit to the Dominican Republic, enjoy a rewarding stay filled with exceptional amenities and services at JW Marriott Hotel Santo Domingo. Book below to reserve your room at the lowest price, guaranteed.

Note: This information was accurate when this article was published, but can change without notice. Please be sure to confirm all details directly with the companies in question before planning your trip.
